title: @Riot, are you aware that immediate feedback report messages aren't working and haven't been since..

replies.body:
As far as I'm aware they're currently working perfectly fine, I just received one myself about a week ago.

What makes you think they're not working?
Because I haven't received a single one since patch 6 dropped yet my account was suspended for 14 days.

The person who receives an instant feedback message isn't the one who was reported, instant feedback is for the people who made the last report in the last game against someone whose account was punished due to those reports.

If you were banned you would've received an email with details regarding your suspension.

> [{quoted}](name=SephirothSG,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=AnV7vm94,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-06T02:39:37.180+0000)
>
> The person who receives an instant feedback message isn't the one who was reported, instant feedback is for the people who made the last report in the last game against someone whose account was punished due to those reports.
> 
> If you were banned you would've received an email with details regarding your suspension.

What are you talking about?  If you've been reported in a game you should receive a message notifying you of such.

So you mean the warning that appears when you get reported? They don't always appear. I believe Seph thought you meant the "thanks to your report someone has been punished" notification.

I've got some more info, and the behaviour alerts are being removed for clarity's sake. The warnings were previously automated, and appeared regardless of if the reports were valid or not, you just had to be reported in a few games (to the best of my understanding). Instead now the warnings are linked directly to the reform cards. Basically, the first chat restriction is now your first of three warnings. You mentioned you have faced a 14 day suspension, which is your third and final warning, you will face a perma ban if you do not reform.

[SOURCE](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/AsT95gjr-i-was-reported-for-verbal-harassment?comment=000100000000)

It's worth noting that if you can demonstrate positive or neutral behaviour for three months you will drop a punishment tier (making your next punishment a 14 day ban), six months and you will drop 2 tiers (making your next a 25 game chat restriction) and so on. A year of good behaviour will reset your punishment tiers.

The warnings were previously automated, and appeared regardless of if the reports were valid or not, you just had to be reported in a few games (to the best of my understanding). Instead now the warnings are linked directly to the reform cards. Basically, the first chat restriction is now your first of three warnings. You mentioned you have faced a 14 day suspension, which is your third and final warning, you will face a perma ban if you do not reform.
> 
> [SOURCE](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/AsT95gjr-i-was-reported-for-verbal-harassment?comment=000100000000)
> 
> It's worth noting that if you can demonstrate positive or neutral behaviour for three months you will drop a punishment tier (making your next punishment a 14 day ban), six months and you will drop 2 tiers (making your next a 25 game chat restriction) and so on. A year of good behaviour will reset your punishment tiers.

I know how the tier system works and I don't really care, this game is a life-waster.

Irrespective of that, you're saying that people don't get warned before anything happens anymore?
I believe you may still get the warning once, but that may also change soon. The chat restrictions are considered warnings after that.
